message.content:
Step 1. Calculate the Operating Cash Flow to Net Income Ratio  
• From the cash flow statement, the Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities is –7,724,112.71  
• From the income statement, Net Profit is –1,352,379.63  
• Ratio = (|–7,724,112.71|) / (|–1,352,379.63|) = 7,724,112.71 / 1,352,379.63 ≈ 5.71

Step 2. Calculate the Current Assets Turnover Ratio  
• Total Current Assets (beginning) = 8,000,000.00  
• Total Current Assets (ending) = 6,951,011.84  
• Average Current Assets = (8,000,000.00 + 6,951,011.84) / 2 ≈ 7,475,505.92  
• Total Revenue from the income statement = 5,755,241.17  
• Ratio = 5,755,241.17 / 7,475,505.92 ≈ 0.77

Step 3. Calculate the Quick Ratio  
• Quick Assets = Current Assets (ending) – Inventory (ending) = 6,951,011.84 – 5,550,000.00 = 1,401,011.84  
• Current Liabilities (ending) = 737,762.05  
• Quick Ratio = 1,401,011.84 / 737,762.05 ≈ 1.90

Thus, the final solution is:

{
  "solution": {
    "Operating Cash Flow to Net Income Ratio": "5.71",
    "Current Assets Turnover Ratio": "0.77",
    "Quick Ratio": "1.90"
  }
}
